Revenue_CPaaS.description: CPaaS revenue driven by SMS/RCS/Voice messaging volume, carrier relationships, and pricing dynamics. Commoditized market with intense competition. Management de-emphasizing; planned for divestiture in 2026.

Revenue_SaaS.description: SaaS revenue (Zenvia Customer Cloud + legacy products) driven by net customer adds, average revenue per user expansion, churn rate, and franchise channel scaling. Primary growth engine post-CPaaS divestiture.

Revenue_Total.description: Consolidated revenue. Critical inflection point: divestiture of CPaaS (72% of FY2025 revenue) creates step-down in total revenue but shifts mix to higher-margin SaaS.

Gross_Margin_CPaaS.description: CPaaS gross margin highly sensitive to carrier cost inflation and competitive pricing. Collapsed from 24% to 12% in one year. Management expects recovery to 20% by Q4 2025 but structural pressure likely persists.

Gross_Margin_SaaS.description: SaaS gross margin driven by AWS/GCP infrastructure costs (~15-20% of revenue), customer support/success costs (~10-15%), and mix shift toward higher-margin Zenvia Customer Cloud (target 70% GM) vs legacy SaaS products (~50% GM).

Gross_Profit.description: Consolidated gross profit. Key insight: mix shift from CPaaS (12% GM) to SaaS (60%+ GM) dramatically improves gross profit dollars, but only if SaaS revenue scales sufficiently to offset CPaaS loss.

OpEx_G&A.description: General & administrative expenses. H1 2025: BRL 48M (8.3% of revenue, down from 14.5%). Management targeting 7% of revenue. Floor: ~BRL 30-35M absolute minimum for public company + LATAM footprint. Operating leverage kicks in only if revenue > 10% CAGR.

OpEx_R&D.description: Research & development expenses. H1 2025: BRL 20M (3.5% of revenue). SaaS-centric model requires sustained R&D to maintain competitive AI/CX features. Expected to increase as % of revenue post-CPaaS divestiture (SaaS more R&D-intensive).

OpEx_Sales_Marketing.description: Sales & marketing expenses. H1 2025: BRL 54M (9.3% of revenue). Franchise model designed to reduce S&M burden (franchisees bear local CAC). Expected to decline as % of revenue if franchise scales.

EBITDA.description: Earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation, amortization. Normalized LTM June 2025: BRL 100M (8.6% margin). Key metric for debt service coverage and valuation. Target: 20-30% margins post-transformation.

D&A.description: Depreciation and amortization. H1 2025: BRL 43M annualized (~BRL 86M annually). Primarily intangible amortization from M&A (~BRL 60-70M). Declines over time as intangibles fully amortize.

NOPAT.description: Net operating profit after tax. Current state: ~BRL 10M (EBITDA BRL 100M - D&A BRL 86M = BRL 14M EBIT, less ~BRL 4M tax provision = BRL 10M). Used for ROIC calculation.

Working_Capital.description: Net working capital requirement. Current: BRL -239M (negative due to high carrier payables). Post-CPaaS divestiture, WC structure changes: (1) lower payables (no carrier costs), (2) SaaS prepayments create negative WC benefit, (3) lower receivables (faster collections). Model as % of revenue with mix adjustment.

CapEx.description: Capital expenditures. H1 2025: BRL 18M (~3% of revenue). CPaaS: low CapEx (mostly IT infrastructure). SaaS: higher CapEx (product development, cloud servers). Expected to increase as % of revenue post-divestiture (4-5% of SaaS revenue).

Invested_Capital.equation: Working_Capital + Intangible_Assets + PP&E (or equivalently: Equity + Debt + Earnouts - Excess_Cash)
Invested_Capital.description: Economic capital deployed in business. Current: BRL 1,056M (77% intangibles from M&A). Post-divestiture: declines by ~BRL 170M (CPaaS IC removed), partially offset by SaaS growth (~BRL 50-100M added over 3 years). Critical for ROIC calculation.

ROIC.description: Return on invested capital. Current: 1.0% (deeply sub-WACC). Target: 10-12% by 2028. Requires both NOPAT expansion (SaaS scaling, margin improvement) and IC optimization (divestiture). Key value driver.

Free_Cash_Flow.description: Unlevered free cash flow. Current: Negative (H1 2025 OCF BRL -18M). Post-divestiture: EBITDA BRL 70-80M - CapEx BRL 25M - WC BRL 0-10M = FCF BRL 45-65M (before debt service). Critical for debt paydown and equity valuation.

Debt_Service.description: Required cash outflow for debt interest, principal amortization, and earnout payments. Current: BRL 115M annually (disclosed 12-month requirement). Post-divestiture: declines to BRL 20-30M assuming 70-80% of proceeds to debt paydown.

Net_Debt.description: Net debt trajectory. Current: BRL 60M (debt BRL 93M - cash BRL 33M). Target: Reduce to BRL 0-50M post-CPaaS divestiture. Key metric for credit risk and equity valuation (EV - Net Debt = Equity Value).

Equity_Value.description: Intrinsic equity value per DCF. Current market cap: BRL 370M ($67M). Valuation hinges on: (1) probability of CPaaS divestiture success, (2) SaaS scaling trajectory, (3) margin expansion realization, (4) discount rate compression as risk declines.

coverage_manifest.description: Verification that all critical financial components are represented in the DAG and linked to valuation

revenue_components.rationale: Revenue decomposed by business segment (CPaaS vs SaaS) to model mix shift from divestiture. Total revenue is derived sum.

margin_components.rationale: Margins modeled separately by segment due to vastly different economics (CPaaS 12% vs SaaS 60%+). Critical for projecting consolidated GP post-mix shift.

operating_expense_components.rationale: Three primary OpEx categories modeled explicitly. G&A has floor constraint (BRL 30-35M). R&D and S&M scale with revenue but at different rates post-divestiture. Covers >95% of OpEx.

profitability_components.rationale: Standard profitability cascade. EBITDA = GP - OpEx. NOPAT = (EBITDA - D&A) × (1 - Tax). Used for ROIC and FCF calculations.

capital_components.rationale: Full capital modeling: WC (operating), CapEx (growth/maintenance), IC (total capital deployed). ROIC links profitability to capital efficiency. Critical for transformation thesis.

cash_flow_components.rationale: FCF = NOPAT + D&A - ΔWC - CapEx (unlevered). Debt_Service and Net_Debt model financing side. FCF after debt service determines equity cash generation.

valuation_linkage.rationale: Terminal node. Equity_Value = f(FCF projections, discount rate, Net Debt). All upstream drivers feed into this valuation output.

strategic_discontinuities_covered.cpaas_divestiture: Modeled as step-function reduction in Revenue_CPaaS (to zero in Year 2) with offsetting cash inflow (divestiture proceeds) and debt reduction.
strategic_discontinuities_covered.sas_scaling: Modeled as elevated Revenue_SaaS growth (20-30% CAGR) with margin expansion (GM: 55% → 65%) and operating leverage (EBITDA margin: 15% → 25%+).
strategic_discontinuities_covered.debt_deleveraging: Modeled via Debt_Service and Net_Debt dynamics. Divestiture proceeds reduce debt, lowering future interest expense and improving FCF available for growth.

missing_components_and_justification.interest_expense: Not explicitly modeled as separate node; embedded in Debt_Service. Interest expense becomes immaterial post-deleveraging (BRL 2-3M annually on residual debt).
missing_components_and_justification.tax_loss_carryforwards: Not explicitly modeled. DTA of BRL 85M exists but realization timing uncertain. Conservative approach: assume cash taxes = (EBIT × 25%) once profitable.
missing_components_and_justification.acquisition_earnout_conversion: Not explicitly modeled in DAG. Treated as financing event: if BRL 100M earnout converts to equity, reduces debt but dilutes FDSO. Modeled in equity bridge (A.2).
missing_components_and_justification.fx_translation: Not modeled. All projections in BRL (reporting currency). FX risk captured in discount rate (EM premium). Avoids complexity of forecasting USD/BRL.
